creator: christian.baumgartner@tiscover.com
text:
when i do a test with JMeter and try to log the output data to a JTL file, i
have the chance to configure that it also should save the HTTP HEADER REQUESTS.
But it doesn't. 
Each Listener that could log to a file, has a button CONFIGURE at the left side.
Clicking on it, opens a dialog box, where I can choose wich data should get
logged. But nevertheless I check the HEADER REQUEST box, it won't log my HEADER
REQUESTS when i start and finish a testrun, without any runtime errors.

I tried it with 2.0.3, Nightly Builds and also the actual from CVS. 

<outline of samplerun.jtl>
<sampleResult timeStamp="1122358626437" dataType="text" threadName="Thread
Gruppe 1-1" label="HTTP Request" time="250" responseMessage="OK"
responseCode="200" success="true"/>
<sampleResult timeStamp="1122358626609" dataType="text" threadName="Thread
Gruppe 1-2" label="HTTP Request" time="78" responseMessage="OK"
responseCode="200" success="true"/>
<sampleResult timeStamp="1122358626937" dataType="text" threadName="Thread
Gruppe 1-3" label="HTTP Request" time="78" responseMessage="OK"
responseCode="200" success="true"/>
</outline of samplerun.jtl>

I suspect the error seen here is fixed in the latest CVS code in 2.1 and though
it may not have made the 2.1 release, it should be in the 2.1.1 release.
creator: mstover1@apache.org
